education.institution: University of North Texas Health Science Center (UNTHSC) – Fort Worth, TX

courses: Nu Rho Psi National Neuroscience Honor Society

work.name: The Lung and Sleep Center of North Texas
highlights: Evaluated and managed common chief complaints such as shortness of breath, chronic cough, pulmonary nodules, and hypersomnia, as well as COPD, asthma, interstitial lung disease, and obstructive sleep apnea
Interpreted diagnostic tests including pulmonary function tests, chest CT and radiographs, pleural fluid analysis
Gained exposure to the management of critically ill and hemodynamically unstable patients requiring mechanical ventilation and vasopressor support in the intensive care unit

work.name: Texas Health Care
highlights: Assessed common complaints, including breast mass, abnormal uterine bleeding, dyspareunia, pelvic pain, and perimenopause for a diverse patient population, ranging from young adult to geriatric
Counseled patients on gynecologic preventative care during Well Woman exams and on routine prenatal care during obstetrics visits
Measured fundal height and doppler heart tones, and assisted with in-office procedures (subcutaneous hormone pellet implantation, colposcopy, IUD insertion, LEEP) and surgery (Cesarean section, LAVH)

work.name: JPS Health
highlights: Constructed treatment plans for patients with schizophrenia and mood disorders in a locked long-term care unit, utilizing findings from extensive chart review, patient interviews, and mental status exams
Evaluated and dispositioned patients in the psychiatric emergency department with chief complaints such as suicidal ideation/attempt, acute psychosis, and acute mania
Developed fund of knowledge through self-guided research of neuroleptic malignant syndrome, catatonia, and schizophrenia management

work.name: Texas Health Harris Methodist Hospital
highlights: Gained exposure to the acute care of critically ill patients in a Level 1 Trauma Center and one of the busiest emergency departments in the country

Assessed patients with a diverse array of acuity levels (ESI 2 to 4) and chief complaints, including altered mental status, falls and motor vehicle collisions, chest pain, abdominal pain, headache, and back pain
Performed and assisted with procedures including laceration repair, splinting, and fascia iliaca nerve block

work.name: SkinMD
highlights: Conducted full body skin exams to screen for skin cancer, including use of dermatoscope
Performed and assisted with cryotherapy, local infiltration, shave biopsy, surgical excision, incision & drainage
Educated patients regarding wound care, sun protection, and common conditions such as actinic keratoses, seborrheic keratoses, melanocytic nevi, acne, and skin cancer

work.name: Texas Health Care
highlights: Assisted surgeon in robot-assisted, laparoscopic, and open procedures, including closing incisions

Gained exposure to pre- and post-operative care of patients in the clinic setting, evaluating patients for surgical management of inguinal hernia, ventral/incisional hernia, hiatal hernia, intraabdominal masses, skin and subcutaneous masses, biliary diseases

work.name: Creekside Family Practice
highlights: Obtained histories and performed physical exams for up to 13 patients/day in a fast-paced outpatient clinic serving a diverse patient population

Educated patients on disease management and prevention, especially emphasizing preventive health screenings and lifestyle modifications for chronic cardiovascular diseases, obesity, and diabetes mellitus

work.name: Center for Neurology and Neurophysiology
highlights: Evaluated common complaints including headache, neuropathy, vestibular disorders, memory loss, and concussion, utilizing findings from comprehensive history-taking and physical exams
Observed chemodenervation injections and nerve blocks for the treatment of refractory headaches and neuromuscular disorders

work.name: John Peter Smith Hospital
highlights: Evaluated and managed up to 3 patients per shift in a diverse, community hospital setting, with complex cases including decompensated cirrhosis, sepsis, acute heart failure, substance use, acute encephalopathy
Presented cases in daily rounds to a team of 1 attending physician, 1 senior resident, 2 interns, and 2 medical students

work.name: Baylor Scott & White Cardiovascular Consultants
highlights: Developed skills to manage patients with complex cardiovascular histories, including those with prior PCI or CABG, valve repair, pacemaker, and those requiring anticoagulation, antiarrhythmic drugs
Gained proficiency in interpreting electrocardiograms

Counseled patients on lifestyle interventions and medication management of prevalent cardiac conditions including atrial fibrillation, heart failure, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, coronary artery disease

work.name: Center for Academic Performance, UNTHSC
highlights: Provided one-to-one tutoring for first- and second-year PA students in Neuroanatomy and Dermatology, emphasizing active learning through teach-back and practice questions

work.name: Atrius Health
highlights: Assisted physicians with rooming and intake, seeing up to 25 patients per day in a fast-paced clinic setting
Performed point-of-care tests including urinalysis, rapid strep, urine pregnancy test, and EKG

work.name: Bouvé College of Health Sciences, Northeastern University
highlights: Guided first-year Doctor of Physical Therapy students in identifying anatomical structures of the skull, brain, and spinal cord on models, human cadavers, and images of cross-sectional slices
Led virtual recitations in preparation for exams

work.name: Boston Health Care for the Homeless Program
highlights: Cared for a diverse patient population, including individuals who were uninsured, non-English speaking, non-citizen status, unhoused, with high burden of psychiatric and substance use disorders
Monitored patients who were sedated or at risk of overdose

work.name: Boston Children’s Hospital
highlights: Provided basic nursing care for pediatric patients with complex neurological and developmental disorders in a 33-bed inpatient unit, responsible for 6-12 patients per shift
Monitored patients with behavioral, seizure, fall, and other safety risks as a one-to-one sitter

volunteer.organization: Black Men in White Coats Youth Summit

projects.name: Yan J, Zwernemann R, Holmes V, Brosnan A. Ruptured ovarian pregnancy: an important differential for abdominal pain
projects.entity: Health Equity Alliance of Tarrant County Summit 2025, Hurst, TX
highlights: Presented Master’s Project at local maternal and child health conference

projects.name: Targeted Access Knowledge and Education (TAKE) on HIV
highlights: Created flyer for patient education on sexually transmitted infections and presented at HSC HIV Symposium
Completed HIV curriculum requirements through the National HIV Curriculum
